intro: Tradescantia coscomatepecana, commonly known as the Mexican spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it both a decorative and potentially invasive species in certain regions. The flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom throughout the growing season, adding ornamental value to gardens.
